rounds.event: Great Depression: President Franklin D. Roosevelt declares a "bank holiday", closing all U.S. banks and freezing all financial transactions.
births: William Davis, German-English journalist and economist
Augusto Odone, Italian economist and inventor of Lorenzo's oil
deaths: Anton Cermak, Czech-American lawyer and politician, 44th Mayor of Chicago

rounds.event: The British ferry MS Herald of Free Enterprise capsizes in about 90 seconds, killing 193.
births: Mário Bližňák, Slovak ice hockey player

rounds.event: Thirty-two people are killed and 81 are injured when gunmen open fire on a ceremony in Kabul, Afghanistan. The Islamic State claims responsibility for the attack.
In the United Kingdom, a walkout at Cortonwood Colliery in Brampton Bierlow signals the start of a strike that lasted almost a year and involved the majority of the country's miners.
deaths: Martin Niemöller, German pastor and theologian
Henry Wilcoxon, Dominican-American actor and producer

rounds.event: Cold War: Joseph Stalin's daughter Svetlana Alliluyeva defects to the United States.
births: Julio Bocca, Argentine ballet dancer and director
Glenn Greenwald, American journalist and author
Shuler Hensley, American actor and singer
deaths: John Haden Badley, English author and educator, founded the Bedales School
Nelson Eddy, American actor and singer
Zoltán Kodály, Hungarian composer, linguist, and philosopher
